item.title: Serbia Surprises With Rate Hike After Hitting Pause Last Month
item.description: Serbia Surprises With Rate Hike After Hitting Pause Last Month Serbia’s central bank raised its benchmark interest rate by 0.5 percentage points to 3.9 percent on Wednesday, surprising analysts who had expected the bank to hold rates steady. The hike was the first since December and comes as Serbia grapples with rising inflation, which hit a 10-year high of 10.
